title: Seeing The Forest For The Trees
excerpt: No matter how well-intentioned we are, sometimes we allow things to sneak into our lives under the guise of it being something important.

title: The Ant Mound
excerpt: One of my earliest childhood memories is traumatic, at least what would seem traumatic to a three-and-a-half-year-old little boy. Though it didn’t turn out to be the end of the world, it sure seemed like a living hell when it happened. I still carry the memory with me a half-century later, so it damaged me on some level.

title: Memorable Cigarettes
excerpt: After nearly fifty years, I can still remember the first time I smoked a cigarette. It was early spring and my family lived on a farm in a semi-rural part of Colorado, a little north of Denver, at the foot of the Rocky Mountains.

title: Start Somewhere
excerpt: Eventually you use up every excuse in your book for not doing the thing you keep saying you’re going to do. You’ve procrastinated yourself into a corner and realize it’s either time to just do it, or finally forget about it and move on.

title: Eliminating Digital Distractions
excerpt: Life is so full of distractions. It seems everything is vying for our attention in one way or another these days, with most of it coming from our electronic gadgets.

title: Saying No
excerpt: Saying no can be one of the hardest things to do.

title: Spin Cycle
excerpt: I’ve been around long enough to know life moves in cycles.

title: Top Chrome Extensions Every Salesforce Admin Needs
excerpt: Most Salesforce admins have a list of favorite Google Chrome extensions they use to make their work just a little easier.

title: Passing Your Salesforce Adm201 Certification Exam
excerpt: I passed the Salesforce ADM201 certification exam today. It’s been a five-year road to get here. From the first week I began working with Salesforce, I decided attaining certification was something I wanted to pursue.

title: Applescript To Compress Files And Folders
excerpt: I had the need to select several folders at once in the Mac OS Finder and zip them up as individual archives. This AppleScript to compress files and folders was the solution I came up with.

title: Salesforce Flows Visualforce And Record Context
excerpt: I was asked to find a solution for our field reps that would simplify the process of adding a completed task to their activities when they visited one of our retail stores.

title: Making A Field Appear Required On A Visualforce Page
excerpt: I’ve been working on a force.com app with the requirement that a user must enter a valid email address on a Visualforce page before being able to save a record.

title: Applescript To Add Files In The Mac Finder
excerpt: Today I had the need to add a bunch of named text files to a folder in the Finder on my Mac.

title: Applescript To Toggle The Mac Desktop
excerpt: Here’s an AppleScript I use to quickly toggle desktop visibility for taking screenshots and recording screencasts that I thought might be useful for others.

title: Rebuilding The Apple Mail Envelope Index
excerpt: Some time ago, I set up my Gmail account in Apple Mail to copy over messages which were not sent to my jimmitchell.org account. I’m one of those guys who likes to have everything all in one place at my finger tips when I need it.
